revised_title: Ion Distribution and Cellular Function in Vertebrate Smooth Muscle
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
tldr: This article discusses the ion distribution and role of calcium in cellular function in vertebrate smooth muscle. The authors analyze the steady-state fluxes of ions, focusing on sodium, potassium, and chloride exchanges. They explore different models to estimate intracellular ion content and membrane permeability, highlighting the challenges in understanding the mechanisms of ion exchange in smooth muscle cells.
